title: How much do parents spend on education technology? - Quora

response.answer_text: According to a Rubicon Project survey [1], parents of K-12 students spent an average of $873 on their children (plural) in 2015. About $390 of that was for technology in general. This summary comes from EdSurge [2]. There currently is no market data on parents’ spending habits on edtech specifically, just numbers for schools and teachers [3]. However, the Consumer Electronics Association calls edtech one of the top 5 “prominent technology trends expected to influence the consumer electronics industry in the years ahead.” [4] So the trend for parent spending on edtech seems to point upwards. Sources: [1] http://rubiconproject.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/09/Holiday-Consumer-Poll-Results.pdf[2] How Much Will Parents Spend on Education Technology This Summer? (EdSurge News)[3] What is the size of the Education technology market?[4] Ed Tech Makes Consumer Electronics Association's Top 5 Trends -- THE Journal

Brett Kopf would be the right guy to ask this question. I am sure parents spend varying amount as their child goes through their education. It would seem as they grow older, opportunities to expand their learning beyond just the classroom increases.
